datahog.api – Functions for manipulating persisted data¶

datahog.api.create_entity(pool, ctx, flags=None)¶

store a new entity

Parameters:
  • pool (ConnetionPool) – a ConnectionPool to use for getting a database connection
  • ctx (int) – the context value for the entity
  • flags (iterable) – the flags to set on the new entity (default empty)
Returns:

an entity dict, which contains guid, ctx and flags keys
Raises:
  • ReadOnly – if given a read-only pool
  • BadContext – if the ctx is not a registered context associated with table.ENTITY
  • BadFlag – if flags contains something that is not a registered flag associated with ctx
datahog.api.get_entity(pool, guid, ctx)¶

retrieve a stored entity

Parameters:
  • pool (ConnetionPool) – a ConnectionPool to use for getting a database connection
  • guid (int) – the guid of the entity to pull
  • ctx (int) – the context of the entity
Returns:

an entity dict (which contains guid, ctx and flags keys) or None if there exists no entity for the given guid/ctx
datahog.api.add_entity_flags(pool, guid, ctx, flags)¶

apply flags to a stored entity

Parameters:
  • pool (ConnetionPool) – a ConnectionPool to use for getting a database connection
  • guid (int) – the guid of the entity
  • ctx (int) – the entity’s context
  • flags (iterable) – the flags to add
Returns:

the new integer flag value, or None if there is no entity for the given guid/ctx
Raises ReadOnly:
 

if given a readonly ConnectionPool
